translation:
Having been addressed to me by the Illustrious Sir on the 26th of last June, with the purpose of notifying me of the rebellion of Porto Alegre, the release of the individuals imprisoned there and the arrest of Marciano, Silvano and more than fifty of their companions, forces having marched from São Leopoldo to the capital to assist the legitimate party of order, in return for such an important notice, and, more than all, pledged by the polite expressions of His Excellency on the 10th of the current month; adding that on the 11th another force of the Division of the Superior Commander Silva Tavares, stationed at the ends of Chasqueiro under the command of Cirilo, was attacked and destroyed by another force under Lieutenant João Simplício, with Cirilo and only two men escaping from that force, the prisoners already being at the Farroupilha fort.

I take the opportunity to extend the respects and consideration to the Illustrious Sir.

Pelotas, 14th of September, 1836.

Domingos José de Almeida.

Colonel Chief of the Legion of the District of Rio Grande.
